sentences.en: Flood waters washed away one of the main bridges in Pusan.
sentences.cn: 洪水冲垮了釜山的一座主要桥梁。

sentences.en: He never washed, and always wore a filthy old jacket.
sentences.cn: 他总是穿着一件从来不洗的脏兮兮的旧夹克。

sentences.en: He seems to have washed his hands of the job.
sentences.cn: 那份工作他好像已经洗手不干了。

sentences.en: He stared at me out of those washed-out blue eyes.
sentences.cn: 他用暗淡无神的蓝眼睛盯着我看。

sentences.en: He's all washed up, but he still yells at everyone.
sentences.cn: 他彻底完蛋了，但仍旧对每个人大吼大叫。

sentences.en: I even washed the flipping bed sheets yesterday.
sentences.cn: 我昨天甚至把那些可恶的床单给洗了。

sentences.en: I took down the curtains, washed, and starched them.
sentences.cn: 我摘下窗帘，洗了洗，然后给它们上了浆。

sentences.en: If my arm touches the wall, it has to be washed again.
sentences.cn: 如果我的胳膊碰到了墙，就得再洗一次。

sentences.en: It took a long time to wash the mud out of his hair.
sentences.cn: 花了很长时间才把泥从他头发上洗掉。

sentences.en: Rain washed out five of the last seven games.
sentences.cn: 由于下雨，最后的7场比赛取消了5场。

sentences.en: She looked washed out and listless.
sentences.cn: 她看上去精疲力竭而且情绪低落。

sentences.en: The force of the water washed him back into the cave.
The oil washed ashore on roughly 1,000 miles of coastline.
sentences.cn: 石油沿着海岸线扩散到了大约1,000英里范围的沿岸海域。

sentences.en: The soil washed from the hills is silting up the hydroelectric dams.
sentences.cn: 从山上冲刷下来的泥土就要让水电大坝淤塞了。

sentences.en: They looked as if they hadn't washed in days.
sentences.cn: 他们看起来好像已经有好些天没洗澡了。

sentences.en: We did odd jobs like farm work and washing dishes.
sentences.cn: 我们做了一些诸如干农活儿和洗盘子之类的零活儿。

sentences.en: Weeks of heavy rain have washed away roads and bridges.
sentences.cn: 几周的大雨将道路和桥梁都冲垮了。

phrases.tran_cn: 褪色的，洗旧了的；筋疲力尽的

trans.tran_en: If you wash something, you clean it using water and usually a substance such as soap or detergent

trans.tran_cn: 洗( wash的过去式和过去分词 )，洗涤，冲，（向着某一方向）流动
